sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
message_1:
Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 4}. Find the following sets: 

(i) (A x B) ∩ {1} x B 

(ii) {1} x (A ∩ B) 

(iii) A x (B ∩ {2}) ∩ ({1} x B). 

Then show that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection using these results.
